prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask☆DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask☆DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desirée DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. Click here to read. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask☆DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Click here for details. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mask☆DeMasque is a master thief that first started his crime spree 6 months ago.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: He's so confident that he sends his calling card before he even commits the crime!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: This was his fifth heist, and as usual, he sent a card on to Lordly Tailor.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: His pattern is to always go after only the most precious art pieces.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's why we're sure it was Mask☆DeMasque, sir. It fits his M. O. to a T!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, I need to go through each piece of evidence and testimony and see if there's a conflict.

First, let's list out all the evidence and testimonies. The testimonies are from Gumshoe, the homicide detective, and he's talking about Mask☆DeMasque. So, his testimonies probably relate to DeMasque's M.O. Now, looking at the evidence, there's a lot about the heist and the evidence left behind.

Evidence 0 is Phoenix's badge, which seems irrelevant here. Evidence 1 is Maya's Magatama, which reacts to people with secrets, but I'm not sure how that ties in yet. Evidence 2 is the Treasure Exhibit Poster, which mentions the Sacred Urn being in Lordly Tailor. Evidence 3 is Ami Fey's Golden Statue, which was moved the night of the crime, carrying the Shichishito. Evidence 4 is the Sacred Urn itself, found in Luke Atmey's office with pink splotches and broken, repaired by Adrian two weeks ago.

Evidence 5 is DeMasque's Calling Card, sent before a heist. Evidence 6 is the Shichishito, which wasn't bent before the crime but was used to knock Atmey out. Evidence 7 is Camera Data, showing the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM. Evidence 8 is Desirée's Letter, addressed to Ron. Evidence 9 is a Security Camera Photo of the storeroom entrance. Evidence 10 is a Blackmail Letter, written by Bullard, found in Ron's room. Evidence 11 is Ron's Wallet, found by Larry. Evidence 12 is a Key Card from Ron's wallet, used for KB Security CEO's office. Evidence 13 is a Publicity Photo of DeMasque. Evidence 14 is DeMasque's Broach found near the statue. Evidence 15 is Kane's Autopsy Report, showing he died at 1 AM with a head injury. Evidence 16 is a Newspaper Clipping about DeMasque's first heist with Ron as a guard. Evidence 17 is the CEO Office Buzzer, no fingerprints. Evidence 18 is Kane's List found at the crime scene. Evidence 19 is Buzzer Record, showing it buzzed at 1:02 AM. Evidence 20 is Ron's Testimony, linking DeMasque to heists via blackmail letters. Evidence 21 is the Urn Box with pink paint. Evidence 22 are Paint Marks, dry and matching the box.

Now, looking at the testimonies:

Testimony 0: Mask is a master thief who started 6 months ago. Testimony 1: He's confident, sends calling cards. Testimony 2: This was his fifth heist, sent a card to Lordly Tailor. Testimony 3: His pattern is to target the most precious art pieces. Testimony 4: It fits his M.O.

So, the testimonies suggest that DeMasque has been active for about half a year, does five heists, sends calling cards each time, and targets high-value art pieces.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 10 is a Blackmail Letter, written by Bullard, found in Ron's room. Evidence 20 is Ron's Testimony that DeMasque was stealing as directed by blackmail letters. So, this connects DeMasque to Bullard's blackmail, which suggests that Bullard was involved in DeMasque's heists.

But Testimony 0 says DeMasque started his spree 6 months ago. Evidence 16 is a Newspaper Clipping about his first heist, which includes Ron as a guard. If this was his first heist, and he's done five, that would mean he started around that time, which might align with the 6-month timeframe. However, if the Blackmail Letters (Evidence 10 and 20) indicate that he started using blackmail after that, perhaps around when Bullard was involved, maybe after the first heist.

Wait, but Testimony 2 says this was his fifth heist, and he sent a card to Lordly Tailor. So, the fifth heist would be the one at the exhibit. Evidence 5 is the Calling Card, which was sent before the heist. So, he sent the card before the fifth heist, which aligns with his M.O.

But looking at Evidence 10 and 20, the Blackmail Letters, it says they were written by Bullard. So, if Bullard was involved in DeMasque's heists, perhaps after his first heist, DeMasque started using blackmail to commit his crimes. That would mean that DeMasque's M.O. evolved over time, using blackmail letters starting from his second heist onwards.

But Testimony 0 says he started 6 months ago, and Testimony 2 says this was his fifth heist. So, if the Newspaper Clipping (Evidence 16) is about his first heist, that would make the fifth heist happen 4 months after the first, which is a bit quick, but possible. However, the Blackmail Letters (Evidence 10 and 20) suggest that he started using blackmail after the first heist, which would make his fifth heist (the exhibit heist) the first time he used blackmail.

But Testimony 2 says he sent a calling card before this fifth heist, which fits his M.O. So, maybe the contradiction is between the timeframe of the heists and the use of blackmail. If the Blackmail Letters were found in Ron's room, and Ron turned himself in as DeMasque, perhaps the heists after the first one used blackmail, which would mean that the fifth heist (the exhibit) was after the first, and the Blackmail Letters were used for the fifth heist.

Wait, but the Blackmail Letters (Evidence 10) were written by Bullard and found in Ron's room. So, if the fifth heist was the exhibit, then the Blackmail Letters would have been used for that. But if the first heist was in June, and the fifth was in October, that's about four months later. So, perhaps the Blackmail Letters were used in the fifth heist, but the first heist was earlier without blackmail.

So, the contradiction might be that Testimony 0 says he started 6 months ago, but Evidence 16 (Newspaper Clipping) shows his first heist, which would be around that time, but then the Blackmail Letters (Evidence 10) were used in later heists, which might not align with the timeframe if the first heist was earlier without blackmail.

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 5. Testimony 2 says this was his fifth heist, and he sent a card to Lordly Tailor, which matches Evidence 5, the Calling Card. So, that's consistent. But perhaps another testimony contradicts something else.

Wait, maybe looking at Evidence 19 and Testimony 0. Evidence 19 is the Buzzer Record, which shows the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. Kane's Autopsy Report (Evidence 15) says he died at 1 AM. cot:
Alright, let's dive into this problem. So, I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a crime. The task is to identify which piece of evidence contradicts which testimony. I need to find one pair where an evidence directly contradicts a testimony. 

First, I'll go through the testimonies to understand what each one is saying. Then, I'll look at the evidence to see which ones could potentially contradict these testimonies.

Looking at the testimonies, Testimony 0 states that Ron claims to be Mask☆DeMasque all along. Testimony 1 says he can't be proven not to be Mask☆DeMasque. Testimony 2 mentions he doesn't have an alibi for the night of the crime. Testimony 3 says he was dressed as Mask☆DeMasque that night. Testimony 4 points out that he's seen in a photo, and Testimony 5 explains that his broach was torn off, not because he was the thief.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 14 is DeMasque's Broach, found near the statue. Evidence 16 is a newspaper clipping showing Ron as a guard during Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Testimony 5 says Ron claims the broach was snagged on a door handle, but the evidence shows it was found near the statue, suggesting he was there as the thief.

So, Evidence 14 (DeMasque's Broach) contradicts Testimony 5 because the evidence shows the broach was found near the statue, not just snagged on a door handle. This suggests Ron was there, supporting his role as Mask☆DeMasque, which contradicts his testimony about the broach.
